intro: Philibertia affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a spherical shape, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs. Philibertia affinis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun conditions.
